snippet: Cultural figures in Russia describe a climate of anxiety as laws banning obscenities have made them compromise their work or face harsh penalties.
abstract: Many Russian artists are censoring themselves in effort to avoid often vaguely defined and enforced Russian laws that ban obscenities in public performances and criminalize offending religious believers; issue has moved into spotlight after Russia's culture minister fired Siberian theater director over Novosibirsk Opera and Ballet Theater production of Wagner's Tannhauser, saying it was offensive to Russian Orthodox Church.
lead_paragraph: Cultural figures in Russia describe a climate of anxiety as laws banning obscenities have made them compromise their work or face harsh penalties.

headline.main: Russian Artists Face a Choice: Censor Themselves, or Else
headline.print_headline: Russian Artists Face a Choice: Censor Themselves, or Else
